213001.name: Raid on Monster City
213001.description:
The monsters are a blight upon the world. Through vile rituals they have enslaved the spirits of the land, using them to power their infernal devices and empower their dark magic. They must be stopped.

By you.

213002.name: In a Den of Vipers
rpg: A Doomed Pilgrim in the Ruins of the Future
213002.description: This is a game of betrayal, cowardice, disloyalty, and self-interest.

213003.name: The World of Mythosa
213003.description:
From the introduction:

The setting information presented here details a land area of roughly four million square miles, slightly larger than Europe and about a third larger than the contiguous United States. Most of this territory is wilderness, some of which had been settled at one time or another but presently is abandoned due to wars, disease, and other calamities. Having been devastated by a magical conflict known as the Thaumaturgical Wars, the population of humanity and its ilk is scattered, with most people living within 50-100 miles of a coast. Overland travel is dangerous, and lawlessness is the norm.

213004.name: Rewired
213004.description:
From the introduction:

Rewired is a "Quick and Dirty" cyberpunk role-playing game. It is a world burned by nuclear fires, locked down by authoritarian states, consumed in corporate greed, and inflicted with technological cancers. It's the grungy, bullet-filled, wet neon streets of the yesterday’s future – or the reality we are just moments from experiencing.

Players take on the roles of Ronin – professional troubleshooters and freelance operatives for hire, willing to stick their necks out on the line for some quick credit. Hackers, gearheads, guns for hire and muscle for rent just make up a few of the anti-heroes of the dark near future.

The goal of this game system is to provide a gritty, deadly set of rules that plays as fast as the genre. Other such games can get weighed down in complex mechanics, redundant weapon catalogs and ridiculous skills lists. Our aim is to keep character creation quick and flexible, combat fast and deadly, and still maintain a level of detail to keep the tactically minded satisfied.

213005.name: Rewired Character Record Sheet
213005.description:
User summary:

This two-page PDF character sheet is intended for print-and-play use.

213006.name: Metroplex Burn
213006.description:
User summary:

Among the fractured sovereign states that have arisen in the shadow of the former USA, The Independent State of Texas stands proud against the onslaught of anarchy and hazards of the south west. Surrounded by Mexican warlords to the south, radioactive badlands to the east and deserted rural wasteland to the north... the Dallas/Ft. Worth Metroplex shines as a monolith of civilization in a wrecked land.

213007.name: Wasted!
213007.description:
User summary:

For Rewired campaigns that take place in nuked-out wastelands (instead of urban sprawls), credit ratings have no use. There’s no uplink to global banks, coins are usually melted down for scrap, and paper money is only good to wipe your ass with.

213008.name: Wasted! Character Record Sheet
213008.description:
User summary:

This two-page PDF is intended for print-and-play use. It is very similar to the standard Rewired Character Record Sheet, save that it is customized for Wasted! play.

213009.name: The Civilized Guide to Tabletop Gaming: Rules Every Gamer Must Live By
213009.description:
(publisher blurb)

Whether you're new to the world of tabletop games or a veteran gamer, The Civilized Guide to Tabletop Gaming is your go-to game-night etiquette guide. Expert gamer Teri Litorco, of the gaming site Geek and Sundry, helps you to get along as you play and make the most out of your time with your gamer group.

Packed with insider advice and etiquette tips, this essential guide includes advice on everything from sharing crib sheets and meeples to avoiding drama and poor sportsmanship at the game table. With 100 gaming etiquette rules, The Civilized Guide to Tabletop Gaming provides you and your group with all you need for a fun and respectful game night--without rage-quitters, bad losers, terrible winners, and Incredible Sulks!

213010.name: Wildlife Preserve
213010.description:
Africa's animals are endangered. Poachers riddle the land. Nature itself is without mercy. You are one of Africa's daring rangers and you are tasked with keeping the animals that wander onto your preserve from harm. Expand your preserve, herd the carnivores away from the herbivores, and ensure that nothing gets unnecessarily eaten.

However, nothing in life is free. Expanding requires capital. How will you earn this capital? Do you take the moral path by giving private safari tours or do you take the darker path by allowing hunters to enter and take whatever prize they wish? These are some of the tough choices you must make while managing your wildlife preserve.

'Wildlife Preserve' is a push your luck card drawing and placement game that offers strategic decisions, elements of luck, and negotiation. Players will draw animals, place them on their preserve, and ensure their safety.

Each animal has a different point value and special ability. The goal of the game is to accumulate and keep as many points as possible in order to beat your opponents.

213011.name: Loulou le jeu
213011.description: Loulou le jeu is a roll and move game in which each player tries to collect four items before freeing Tom from the claws of Gaspard the wolf. Depending on the die roll, they can also move the wolf to go frighten other players and make them lose an item. Players can also get cards to help them in their quest. The first player to collect all items and reach the centre of the board wins.

213014.description: Second expansion for Bestiary of Sigillum. Includes 9 new characters and new map for team play. Expands player count to 4.
213014.name: Bestiary of Sigillum: Quadrivium

213015.name: WINGS: Over Flanders Fields
213015.description:
World War 1 Flight simulator

An immersive WW1 environment, including "no-mans land" front line that moves with major advances, the best WW1 Pilot Artificial Intelligence for thrilling immersive combat in 'WOFF UE'.

Over 80 flyable aircraft included, easily jump into Quick Combat, or delve deeper into the full immersion of WOFF's superb dynamic campaign, where any of the 450 historical squadrons perform their historical mission roles around you in uniquely generated missions.

Detailed history, Aces, Aircraft and more.

WOFF UE is the ultimate WW1 flight simulator for PC.

Source: The Game Website.

213016.description:
This French-only promo mini-expansion consists of 10 cards

One aggression card, "Châtiment de Némésis"
Four isolated elements
Card with new rules
Two art cards
Two advertisements




The new aggression card replaces the Hécatonchires ("Hekatonkheires") card. Its effect is to discard the last played card; if that card was already discarded, nothing happens.

The isolated elements replace elements without symbols. An isolated element can only be played directly after an Aggression or Nature card. Otherwise, it is discarded.
213016.name: Kreus: Châtiment de Némésis

213017.name: Schoolgirl Sidekicks
213017.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five young ladies with special abilities are learning to make the most of their strange lives. During the day, they study together as class mates. At night, they defend the city from dangerous criminals. They are the Schoolgirl Sidekicks and they are ready to join your campaign.

213018.name: Best of British Trivia
213018.description:
Description from the box:

How much do you know about the British Isles? Can you recognise a landmark from its silhouette, or make out a phrase from a particular dialect and translate it into common English?

This brain-teasing pack of quiz cards includes 150 questions in 5 fascinating categories. Play in teams or go head to head to prove who has the biggest British brain!

213019.name: Minions of the Yellow King
213019.description:
From the introduction:

You have just finished your breakfast and the town's Mayoress has arrived and is wanting your help...

User summary:

For 5th - 8th level characters.

213020.name: A Picture is Worth a Thousand (S)words
213020.description:
The "Art" of War

From the introduction:

This adventure takes place as two elven guilds are on the brink of war after a masterpiece goes missing. Each clan accuses the other of taking a painting created by their shared founder, and without the return of the painting the region will surely be plunged into a long and costly war. The players will track down the painting and discover the culprits to maintain peace, as well as face off against a deadly golem.

An adventure for five 3rd level characters

213021.name: (Fun) Wild Magic Surge Table Volume 1
213021.description:
Amusing Wild Magic

From the introduction:

The Wild Magic Surge Table is a great tool for those sorcerers who love to introduce chaos into roleplaying. However, the table presented in Player's Handbook (D&D 5e) has some effects that are rather boring...This supplement is here to inject a bit of fun, humor, and unique roleplaying opportunities for a sorcerer and their victims... err... party members.

213022.name: (Fun) Wild Magic Surge Table Volume 2
213022.description:
More Amusing Wild Magic

From the introduction:

Volume two of the (Fun) Wild Magic Surge Table can be combined with the previous table or used alone.

213023.name: (Fun) Wild Magic Surge Table Volume 3
213023.description:
Further Amusing Wild Magic

From the introduction:

Here is volume three of the (Fun) Wild Magic Surge Table. This release sports a full 100 different Wild Magic Options. This table can be combined with the previous [two tables], or used on its own.

213024.name: Bunny Go Down the Hole
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213024.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Tomorrow is the beginning of Brewfest, and you have been invited to the Gnarley Forest as guests of both the Magister and the High Druid to celebrate that occasion.

Part 2 o the Gnarley Adventure.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213025.name: Corsair!
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213025.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The great expanse of the Nyr Dyv is before you. The wind whips back your hair, as you struggle to gain your sea legs. Do you imagine there will be pirates out here?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213026.name: Blinded by the Darkness
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213026.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

As the tools of divination slowly disappear from Dyvers, those groups that depend on them are forced to find another way to see - another way to discover the truth. At least one of these groups thinks you can find it for them. Can you get past the veil, and find out what has caused them to be blinded by the darkness?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

213027.name: Bragging Rights
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213027.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You find yourself being rustled from your bed early after some Freeday revelry. Words are exchanged and it quickly begins to look like the honor of a member of the gentry, or perhaps the Free City of Dyvers itself, is at stake. Can the [player characters] rise above the opposition for the challenge, or will their bone-picked carcasses litter the surrounding countryside?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

213028.name: The Power of Gold
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213028.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

While sometimes the life of an adventurer can be a tough one, every once in a while it pays off. Today has been fantastic! Your hard work has finally paid off and you've been invited to a prestigious event. Life couldn't get any better than this. Perhaps fate has finally smiled upon you.

Part Two of the Kadoran series.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213029.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 78 - Nov/Dec 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Active Measures: Search for the Stardrive
Active Measures: The Star of People’s Justice
Doing It My Way: Prison Inmate
Doing It My Way: Secret Police Forces in Traveller
In A Store Near You: Net Guns For Mongoose Traveller
Introduction to the Freelance Traveller Cookbook
Raconteur's Rest: A Problem Like Myra, Part 3
Raconteur's Rest: After Action Report: TravellerCon/USA 2016
The Prep Room: Building an Adventure
The Prep Room: System Generation/Adaptation from ACCRETE
Up Close and Personal: Zachary Higgins-David
213029.description:
From the contents page

Freelance Traveller #078: Nov/Dec 2016

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

213030.name: Strike!
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213030.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Several professional guilds are on strike, and it doesn't look like the Gentry are going to give in. Can something be done to ease the growing tensions in the city?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213031.name: Every Man's Dream
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213031.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The gates of Dyvers lie just ahead. Inside, merchants from every nation strike bargains. What excitement and adventure await you in the greatest city of the Flannaes?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213032.name: Out of the Blue
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213032.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A hush has fallen over the once boisterous Dyvers Adventurer's Guild. Someone or something has been spiriting away adventurers. What has become of them is anyone's guess. Can you solve the mystery while there is still time to save those that are lost?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213033.name: Eloped
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213033.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Daddy wants his little girl back, so she can be married. Thing is, she hasn't accepted any proposals yet, and several of her suitors disappeared at about the same time she did. Where is she? Is she okay? Did she just pick someone dad doesn't like, and elope?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

213034.name: The King of Box Town
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213034.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

For far too long the destitute of the Free and Independent City of Dyvers have gone unnoticed. It was only a matter of time before a leader arose to help them. The prayers of the desperate appear to have been answered as a king has arisen among them. Will this mysterious individual lead his people to revolt or help them in their time of need?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

213035.name: A Crime of Faith
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213035.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A prominent church has been robbed in the city of Dyvers. The law has been unable to solve the crime, and the guard has become particularly edgy. Seeking out thieves in a city of rogues is a difficult job; perhaps you are clever enough to find the guilty?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

213036.name: Will You Be Mine?
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213036.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A rich noble, an obsessed suitor, a beautiful maiden - just another day in the life of the Dyvers gentry.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

213037.name: Stonethrow To Winter's End
213037.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 1st Level Introductory Adventure for 3-5 Characters for the Havenshield RPG. "Stonethrow to Winter's End" this adventure covers a small area near the town of Magefall in the Eastern Marches of Havvengarde, a dungeon, wilderness encounters, some prerolled characters and more…

213038.name: Zendrelda's Tower
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213038.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Musings of the Sage Burroe, based on the tower origins correspondence of D. T. Burrows.

User summary:

An adventure for 1st level characters.

213039.name: High Stakes
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213039.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

A Dyvers spy has reported that the Blade of Chaos, stolen eighteen years ago from the Dyvers temple of Norebo, has returned to the City. Anyone who retrieves this lost artifact of chaos can expect great fortune from the God of Gambles. All of your skills and luck will be on the line, because the criminal bosses of Dyvers’ gritty underworld would love to have the Blade, and they are stacking the deck against you. Note: Lawful characters will reduce the party's chances of success in this adventure. It furthers the cause of chaos, and success requires some unlawful activities.

An introductory adventure for level one characters.

213040.name: M.A.C. / Magical Animal Control
213040.description:
A RPG of dealing with problematic magical creatures in a increasing magical world.

Magic is real, and animals, bugs, and even plants with magical abilities sometimes are a problem. It’s your job as a agent of the Magic Enforcement Agency to deal with magical problems and as all such agents you first have to do at least a year in the MAC.

Hellhounds, flying buffalo, talking grapevines, and even mind controlling fungal infections. All in a days work for a our fine men and women of the MAC.

213041.name: Feather, Feather, Where is the Feather?
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213041.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Murder has disturbed the characters while they are passing through the lovely Halfling village of Banebridge. The town’s marshal is away in Dyvers on business, and won’t be back for days. Are the intrepid heroes up to the task of
finding the perpetrator?

And adventure for characters [level] 1 – 8.

213042.name: This Week in Geek History
213042.description:
Play a famous person whose birthday it is! Go on adventures with others born near that day of the month, but not necessarily year - or even century! Can Abraham Lincoln and Lorne Greene defeat the evil plans of Thomas Edison and Ice T? Play to find out!
Players pick characters from a given week of the excellent Steve Donohue blog, This Week in Geek History. They then take turns GMing each other through plots written by the very players they are challenging!

213043.name: Tales by Candlelight
213043.description:
From the introduction:

Darkness crawls across the screen. The soundtrack eerily rises and falls behind the all-too quiet sounds of footsteps. Something shifts in the background. These are the tools and tricks of horror movies. The goal of this game is to bridge the gap between film and games- to allow you to bring that unique form of storytelling to your group of friends. The objective of this game is not to win, but to tell a scary story that follows the same sort of narrative arc of a horror movie. Remember that the only difference between horror and comedy is tone, and choose which one is best for your group. Have fun.

213044.name: Hellfire
213044.description:
In the year of our lord 1324 came the Shadows, a slow blackening of the eyes, from white, through gray, to glinting obsidian, and then… the fires.
When first it came, many feared evil magicks as eyes began to turn from pure white to ash and smoke, then coal. But nearly all were afflicted to at least some small degree save the pure and the simple. Was it perhaps a sign of sin? Yet, even the priests bore some mark, but as none are without sin, this still seemed possible, and over time, eyes grew darker and darker. Given just how many peasants developed Shadowed eyes suggested
that it was a reflection of sin. After all, they were coarse, unrefined, filthy. They couldn’t even read the bible on their own, and their poverty clearly proved God showed them no favor.
Then came the reports of the fires, the screams, the burning. Men were seen to burst violently into flames in their fields. Princes in their chambers, priests in their cathedrals. Most, though not all, bore at least some whisper of deep corruption and shame, and those for whom no sin could be determined, it was said, they must have carried their sins deep within their hearts and behaved most wickedly in private. Why else would the Lord see fit to have them taken by the fires of Hell?
Worse still, when one would be consumed by the hellfire, others often followed. Perhaps it was the invisible demons, who once loose, wished to cause as much mayhem as possible before they returned.
It is said that those who go on pilgrimage to atone for their sins, to find those whom they have wronged and make amends are able to wash their eyes clean and turn them white once more.
So serious is this plague, that lords and ladies are known to grant far more leeway to their serfs who suffer from sinner’s eyes to leave the lands untilled. Perhaps this is because they do not wish their hellfire consumed, damned souls on their conscience should the peasantry not cleanse themselves of sin in time. Perhaps they simply do not want their crops and their mills consumed by fire.
Unfortunately, as will all sin, there comes temptation, corruption, those eager to do the devil’s work in order to hide from the devil. This came in the form of Angel’s Milk, a sweet drink that brings feelings of peace and forgiveness, and whitens the eyes for a few hours, only for the stains to come back darker not long after.
Now the roads are littered with black-eyed travelers, called Shadow Pilgrims, each out to find those they have sinned against and do right by them. One should be warned, however, that those who seek absolution for the wrong reasons, merely to lift the Shadows that stain their eyes rather than to actually do good works, often find themselves worse for their troubles, if not consumed wholly in fire. Heaven will not be deceived. To purify one’s eyes, one must seek to purify one’s soul.
You are such a Shadow Pilgrim, walking the lonely road, enduring the judging gazes from those who know that you are a great sinner. Living among those who would cross the streets to be away from you, who would bar their doors to you, both for the welfare of their souls and to avoid the flames should you burn soon. Beware, oh traveler, for even those who would not flee from you may abuse your trust, and put you to ill use saying that to labor for them will show God that you are contrite and humbled and will surely cleanse you. Beware such
Shadow Slavers who will guilt you into servitude. There day will come for their sins to black their eyes to coals that the fires of Hell may burn them, but yours approaches much sooner and you may not have time to tarry.
Can you face the wounds within, make amends with the world, and save not only your body, but also your soul?

213045.name: WarFire
213045.description:
User Summary

WarFire is an adventure shooting game.

213047.name: Gravity Shot
213047.description:
User Summary

Sling shot explosive nuclear warheads into collision course with your planetary assassination targets.

213049.name: I Reckon So
213049.description:
I Reckon So is a competitive RPG for 4 or more people.

One of those people will be in charge of running the game and portraying any personality in the game who isn’t one of the characters being portrayed by the rest of the players at the table. We’ll call them the Buckaroo. Why? Because we can.

The game is played in rounds. One round is played for each player other than the Buckaroo. So, if there’s 5 people at the table, you’ll play 4 rounds.

The goal of the game is to amass the most points by the end of the final round.

Each round of the game is played out at a wild west saloon, and involves characters created by the Buckaroo and the players. Some of the information determined at the start of each round is meant to be kept a secret until the end of the game, so be sure to follow the setup instructions and refrain from giving away any hidden information!

213050.name: Knockumbones
213050.description:
From the introduction:

You used to be alive, and that really sucked; but now you’re dead so congratulations!

You’ve been drafted into this year's Skeleton War by the great and powerful Necromancer. For one day each year you and all your skeleton buddies get to leave the crypt to recruit more to your cause. Good luck, and knock ‘em dead!
...
You are tasked with going out into the world and killing as many meatbags as you can before the day is over. The player with the most kills at the end of the game is declared the winner.

213051.name: Dead Are Among Us
213051.description:
From the introduction:

Dead Are Among Us is a table-top roleplaying game of scary monsters and people who interact with them. I wanted to make this game as funny and flexible as possible. Through fictional characters, you’ll be able to play most of the horror stories you’ve seen in the movies or read in the books.

User summary:

The document includes several pages of print-and-play components (tracking sheets and character sheets).

213052.name: PM GALAXY: A Project Management Board Game
213052.description:
PM Galaxy is a collaborative and competitive board game for 3 to 5 players, where each player, alias „project manager”, takes control of a distinctive project. Although each project manager fights to be the first one to complete his or her project, these projects are interdependent and share, as it always happens, limited resources. The task of each project manager is to guide their projects through its phases, gathering resources by answering quizzes and investing those resources to overcome challenges.

The board game has been developed as a tool to facilitate the learning of project management concepts in a fun and engaging way. It is intended for project management trainers and consultants, project managers, project team leaders and team members. Basically, for all those involved in projects who want to improve their project management knowledge while having a great time together with their team!

213053.description:
Description from the publisher:

This card is both a thank you and a memento for being part of the realization of the game. Produced in limited numbers and only be available during this Kickstarter campaign, at our rare convention appearances, and a select online store after the campaign, the card introduces a rather unique story function into the game

Card effect: Should your Captain perish on the snowy tundras of the Pole, you may claim this card. Though your team is eliminated from the race, the annals of history will see fit to remember your Captain, above all others. Everyone loves a polar hero - especially a dead one! Let the Glorious Death card be your historic vindication.
213053.name: Snowblind: Race for the Pole – A Glorious Death Promo Card

213055.name: Gute Nacht
213055.description:
Gute Nacht is a 3D game in which the little princess Enni does not want to go to bed. Time after time, she gets up because she needs something: a glass of water, a bedtime story...

In more detail, this is a small, memory-type game in which storytelling and role-playing can become part of the game. The game — part of HABA's "Sleepy Princess" (Erbsenprinzessin) line — is for the youngest children to slowly ease them into the world of games and help them understand easy-to-grasp rules.

213056.name: Funeral for a Friend
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213056.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The city mourns the passing of Shenree Cale, one of its kindest benefactors. When she is about to be laid to eternal rest the body turns up missing! Can you and a handful of friends find out what is going on? There are those that would see you fail if they have their way.

An Adventure for Characters levels 1 - 10.

213057.name: Tickling the Tail of the Dragon
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213057.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The job was simple: Deliver a cargo from Dyvers to Maraven. In the desperate days of Dyvers, banditry may not be the only crime threatening the City of Sails.

An adventure for [characters levels] 2 - 10.

213058.name: Splintered Timbers
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213058.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Efforts to rebuild the city after the fire are in high gear, and almost everyone in Dyvers is doing their part. After the Gnarley Rangers grudgingly allow increased tree cutting, one carpenter seeks adventurers to escort him into the Gnarley Forest. Are you ready to do your part to help the city in its hour of need?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

213059.name: One for Those Long Gone
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213059.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Life is always busy in the city of sails. Now that things have settled down some of the dock district reconstruction is in full swing. Any day now life should return to normal, the homeless settled and again back among the working class. Maybe now you can relax and take it easy for a while?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 12.

213060.name: Dock Work
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213060.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The sounds of construction are everywhere in the city, but nowhere are they more deafening than the dock district. Still, it is an awesome sight to behold a construction job this large. With all the populace united in this work effort, what could possibly go wrong?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 12.

213061.name: A Cure for What Ails Ye
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213061.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A request for aid comes from a strange source, one that doesn’t know why he’s asking for aid. Will you help him out?

Part 1 of the Hidden Treasures Saga.

An adventure for characters level 2 - 12.

213062.name: Exile
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213062.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The signal fire has gone out on Merroc's Rock, hampering shipping traffic into Dyvers. The PC's are sent to investigate and to restore the beacon before disaster strikes.

An adventure for characters level 2 - 12.

213064.name: The Trade
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213064.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Gnarley spider silk is all the rage amongst the fashionable and well to do in the city of sails and commands a high price. Will the players brave the fabled elven city of Locdrathnaii to obtain it?

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

213065.name: The City of Sales
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213065.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

In a city where the largest temples are the merchant gods Zilchus and Xerbo, it seems like everyone has something to sell, some angle, or some scheme. There are times, though, when skilled adventurers find someone with a worthy cause. Typically that person is just a better salesman than most.

A Dyers introductory adventure for first level characters only.

213066.name: Lion of Westguard
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213066.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

The Knight Commander of Westguard requests the assistance of able adventurers to solve the recent abductions from Low Town. Interested parties are requested to seek an audience at the Keep.

A Dyvers introductory adventure for 1st-level characters.

213067.name: Legacy of Elemental Evil
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213067.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Pri Tiu-cxi Lingvo... The Mandragore has its eye upon Dyvers. Will you be able to root out the source of an old evil thought long vanquished?

An adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

213068.name: Basement Cleaning
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213068.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The new Shrine of Kord in the City of Sails was built on the site of a business that burned to the ground with its owner still in it. While cleaning out the old basement storage area, two workers have disappeared. Are the rumors that the land is haunted true? Are you brave enough to find out?

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

213069.name: Urban Renewal
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213069.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The damage has been repaired to the Dock District and the Magister has asked several adventurers to speak at the ribbon-cutting ceremony. Not only were you one of those chosen, but you’ve also been invited to another engagement on the same day! It looks like Dyvers is back to business as usual... or is it?

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

213070.name: A Dream Given Form
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213070.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

At night, your dreams whisper of a dark deed that will soon come to pass deep in the Gnarley Forest. Only those adventurer’s brave enough to delve deep into the Gnarley Forest need to respond. This is the final chapter in the Gnarley Adventure series.

An outdoor adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

213071.name: Tiptoeing Among Dragons
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213071.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Maraven constabulary is ready to extradite an abominable criminal to the justice system of Dyvers. You have been asked to escort the lawbreaker for his own protection.

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

213072.name: A House Divided
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213072.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Tales of the Gnarley Dragon in the Ehlenwood fief have begun to surface just days before a member of a minor gentry house is lost while enroute to the Gnarley Forest for a hunting expedition. Was this the work of bandits? Has the Gnarley Dragon developed a taste for the finer things in life? Or is there a more sinister plot beginning to unfold?

Part one of the Machinations Saga.

An adventure for [character levels] 4 - 12.

213073.name: Tipping Cows
213073.description:
Tipping Cows is a dexterity game of bovine shenanigans. Players take turns flicking discs in order to tip a cow (a.k.a. knock it over). Obstacles are in the way, however, and you lose a turn knocking into a tree. Hit a cowpie, and you lose one of your flickers.

After all cows are tipped, they score one point each or a loss of two for knocking over the bull. Special and optional rules add to the game for the different types of cows.

Highest score wins!

213074.name: Loonacy: Fruitcake Fun Pack Expansion
213074.description: Released during one of Looney Labs' free holiday gift giveaways, it contains five cards: fruitcake/ship; fruitcake/statue of liberty; fruitcake/house; fruitcake/the looneys; and fruitcake/chocolate bar. Requires Loonacy base game to play.

213075.name: Tides of Tambrosh
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213075.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Crime is up, and the poor have become restless. It seems like trouble will never leave the City of Sails alone. A trio of representatives offers a decent breakfast at the Sword and Tankard, seeking your assistance in solving a dilemma that plagues them.

Part 2 of the Hidden Treasures Saga.

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

213076.name: Linchpin
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213076.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

While enjoying a quiet day in Dyvers, you receive an oblique invitation to a secret meeting with the guildmaster of the Dweomercrafter’s Guild. As you look at the imposing towers of the guild looming over the walls surrounding the royal district, you have to wonder: what manner of subterfuge are you getting involved in?

A pivotal module to the future of Dyvers for [character levels] 10 - 16.

213077.name: Setting in the West
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213077.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The lost parts of the Niadeen Codex have been recovered. Adventurers and mercenaries are summoned to escort the fragment of the ancient book to the Keep at Westguard and to guard the ceremony where a new leader will take on the mantle of the Hierarch of the Ring of Steel. Meanwhile, enemies gather from across the Flanaess to prevent the transfer of power. This adventure is the finale of the Ring of Steel series.

An adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213078.name: The Riddle of Bainbridge Manor
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213078.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Tragedy in Bainbridge. Can you help the sun shine down on this once benevolent village?

A Dyvers interactive adventure for [character levels] 2 - 16.

213079.name: Maraven Inn
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213079.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

With the docks restored, ship traffic to Dyvers is increasing, taking more of the Navy’s resources. Slavers are taking advantage of the lessened patrols, raiding merchant ships near Eastgate Island.

A Dyvers introductory adventure for first level characters.

213080.name: A House, A Door, A Dilemma
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213080.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

The city of sales, the city of opportunity, but only it seems so if you’re already experienced or know someone. Unfortunately, without knowing someone or being experienced already there are few opportunities for the would-be adventurer. Perhaps today will be different.

A Dyvers Introductory adventure for first-level characters.

213081.name: Nature's Child
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213081.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

An ally from the Gnarley Forest has asked for the temple of Obad-hai’s blessing upon his child, and they need someone to chaperone the child from the forest back to the temple. A short trip through the Gnarley to escort the child to Obadhai’s temple can’t be too difficult for a group of adventurers can it?

A Dyvers introductory adventure for 1st-level characters.

213082.name: Exoneration
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213082.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is not unheard of for adventurers to be hired to retrieve an item from the sewers under the city of sails. It is a little unusual when the Dyvers Sewer Patrol needs a group of daring adventurers to enter the dangerous tunnels.

An introductory module for 1st-level characters.

213083.name: Rising in the East
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213083.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Six years ago Her Excellency Larissa Hunter, Magister of Dyvers, appointed the Seffren and Herall families to the easternmost fiefs in the Free Lands of Dyvers as a reward for their loyalty. Greyhawk City would no longer be able to subvert Dyvers gentry for their own machinations. But the magister is gone now...

A Dyvers regional adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213084.name: Dining with the Dragon
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213084.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

With civic tensions skyrocketing and accusations of slave traffic increasing, Lord Darian Kesser calls together the entire Gentry Council at a banquet in his city manor. Those people who wish to bring Kesser's dark activities to light ask you to take advantage of his divided attention and infiltrate his manor so that the truth may be revealed.

A time-sensitive adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

Part 3 of The Most Despicable Evil series.

213085.name: No More!
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213085.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

No magister. No government. No peace. No hope. No Dyvers. Not any more. The City of Sails stands on the precipice. The only thing keeping it from being lost to history... is you.

A Dyvers regional adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213086.name: Riposte
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213086.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

As foreign troops once again enter the city, the announcement spreads like wildfire. All able and willing volunteers are to report to the docks immediately. The entirety of the Free Army, Free Marines, and Navy has been activated. The largest Dyversian military force ever assembled crosses the Nyr Dyv to the Empire of Iuz as the City of Sails goes to war.

A Dyvers regional adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213087.name: Matters of the Heart
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213087.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

As the siege against the forces of Iuz rages, the Gentry Council approaches you with a request. The demon-cambion Kurault has been located. You are asked to cross the border into the Empire of Iuz to exact justice.

A Dyvers regional adventure for characters levels 10 to 18.

Rogues and Rangers will excel in this adventure.

213088.name: End of the Line
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213088.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Reward the faithful. Punish the wicked. Reciprocity in the Free Lands.

An adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213089.name: Casualties of War
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213089.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

With success against the Empire of Iuz, the return of the Dyversian armada, and the reestablishment of the Gentry Council, Dyvers finally has time to rest and take account of the past year. With so many great deeds, did anything fall through the cracks? Or worse, anyone?

A Dyvers regional adventure for character levels 1 to 14, and denouement of the Dyvers 5-year story arc.

213090.name: What Know You of Peace
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213090.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

For the first time in four years, all three trade routes—the Velverdyva, the Nyr Dyv, and the Gnarley Road—are open and unobstructed. Merchants return en masse and Dyvers remembers that it is a mercantile city, not a warrior state. Can there be peace at last?

An adventure set in the Gnarley Forest and the prelude to The Gnarley Threat, a new Dyvers regional story arc, for character levels 1 to 14.

213091.name: The Brain Gorger's Appetite
213091.description:
From the back of the book:

An adventure for 4 to 6 characters levels 1 to 3.

For the most part, the town of Ockney's Hold has always been a peaceful place- bordering on boring. The most interesting things going on in this frontier mining settlement include the annual livestock fair, the cost of spirits at its various inns, and speculation fueled by those same spirits as to what foul things are being dumped into the river by the ore refinery. Recently, however, the usually placid Baron Reinson has begun to act erratically, ignoring most of his counselors, giving more responsibility to his equally erratic chamberlain, and replacing key figures in Ockney's Hold with outsiders. With no clear answers as to what might be behind the baron's strange behavior, his last loyal counselor seeks out a band of adventurers to help. Will these brave heroes be able to get to the bottom of a widening conspiracy? And can they expose the terrible and unseen forces manipulating the baron in time to save Ockney's Hold?

213092.description:
With adolescent, adult and ancient Chronos causing mayhem in the tavern, he is a riot to play!

The Red Dragon Inn: Chronos expands the party at the Red Dragon Inn with a time traveling mage whose age is constantly in flux, shifting from adolescence to adulthood to elder.

The Red Dragon Inn: Chronos the Time Mage includes a single Character Deck, plus a player mat to add a brand new character to your game.
213092.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Chronos the Time Mage

213093.name: The Druid in the Dark Forest
213093.description:
From the back of the book:

An adventure for 4 to 6 characters levels 2 to 4.

The village of Rodham is an isolated forest commune. It seems the woodland village has recently been repeatedly attacked by wild beasts led and goaded by an evil druid. Will you answer the call? Will you brave the wilds and help this desperate community?

213095.description: Tactics is the first mini expansion for Xibalba. It adds 32 new event Cards to your regular games of Xibalba and offers a lot more interesting choices and possibilities.
213095.name: Xibalba: Tactics Expansion

213096.name: Two Tribes
213096.description:
Based on the BBC TV games show that ran from 2014-2015 hosted by Richard Osman

Each turn players are split into two tribes (teams), a Yes tribe and a No tribe, based on their answer to a question (for example "I prefer dogs to cats"). Each tribe then answers trivial questions trying to win as many points as possible.

After a full round the two players with the most individual points compete head to head in a buzzer round, the first to answer 3 questions correctly wins.

213097.name: Coulin
213097.description:
Description from the publisher:

Coulin is a dice game where players fight each other to gain control of every die involved in a game. Coulin is a fast, portable, easy to learn game which can be played by both hard boardgamers and newcomers. The art of the 3D-printed dice is just amazing! Set in a world of fantasy, Coulin features dice with sides like the Crown, the Skull, the Eye or the Wall. Each of them allow you to perform one different action. Choose wisely!

When a turn begins, choose any amount of dice among those you own and roll them. Then, choose an action among the ones availables (depending on your dice roll) and perform it. You can steal dice from other players, protect your own, lose some... If a player owns every die in a given turn, he or she wins the game. If no one reaches this condition after 10 turns, the player with the most amount of dice wins.

213098.name: Skæg & skøre briller
213098.description: A Danish family trivia and party game with a schtick: A beard-and-glasses mask. If you gain the beard and glasses, you are temporarily out of the game.

213099.description:
Journey back to 15th century Spain in Lumen Fidei, the fifth expansion (and sixth scenario) for T.I.M.E Stories. In the adventure, you and your friends must infiltrate a secret meeting of the Christian militant orders to steal a precious item for the Agency — but all is not as it seems. A mysterious stone has drawn the attention of Christians and Moors alike, and the presence of something supernatural may be at work in the darkness. It's your mission to find out the truth, and return to the T.I.M.E Agency with the stone safely in your possession...

This expansion features an additional challenge as the pressure on players is not only about time, but it also involves moral choices, a powerful opponent, and new mechanisms. Discover lots of new information about the T.I.M.E Stories universe, within a historical scenario and an intriguing setting...
213099.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Lumen Fidei

213100.name: Illuminatus
213100.description:
Description from the publisher:

You Are The Conspiracy!
Set in the modern world, Illuminatus is a conspiracy themed strategy board game for 2-6 players ages 14+ (or younger if accompanied by a member of the intelligence services).
Played over a world map first agree the end of the world theme for each game - what will yours be? Perform False Flag attacks and assassinations to destabilise regions and governments around the world. Influence world events, research new technologies to get an edge on your fellow players, declare a "War on.." something and reap the profits. Complete hidden agendas to win all before the end of the world! You are the conspiracy! (for a night anyways)

Caution this is not a Eurogame. Put your safe spaces away. Triggering encouraged. Illuminatus is Rated "C" for Conspiracy.

213101.name: Festival of the Blood Moon
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213101.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The City of Sails swells with merchants from around the Flanaess. Dyvers is abuzz with news from the Gnarley. Free Army scouts camp near the village of Tricaster, and a festival is planned to celebrate its annexation. A request from a troubled quartermaster gives you good reason to travel, but perils lay in wait. Beginning of “the Gnarley Threat” set in the village of Tricaster.

A Dyvers regional adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

213102.name: Into the Dragon's Maw
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213102.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Dyvers Anti-Slavery League is close to discovering the location of a slaver cell in the area. The DASL needs the PCs’ help in uncovering this information. Once they know where the slavers are headquartered, an intrepid strike force needs to defeat the leader and free the slaves.

The fourth and final part of the Most Despicable Evil series, a two-round adventure for character levels 1 to 14.

In service of the greater good, laws will be broken in this adventure.

213103.name: Forevergreen
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213103.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Located so near the growing menace, the orc horde has turned its attention on Lockswell Manor. With the annexation of the Gnarley and the expansion of the Dyvers border, the question now becomes, who is responsible for the manor's safety. Both Dyvers and Greyhawk appear to lay claim to the land, a spark that could start a blaze.

A Dyvers regional adventure of diplomacy and opportunism and a stage in The Gnarley Threat for character levels 1 to 14.

213105.name: The Dyvisive Deep
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213105.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Six weeks ago, a group of wide-eyed sailors was fished out of the Nyr Dyv telling tales of terrible beasts of the lake rising up and rending their ship to splinters. Since then, more sailors have been fished from the lake with equally fantastic tales, some even claiming the lake itself was striking against them. It is no surprise then when Guildmaster Nathas of the Dyvers Adventurer’s Guild posts a job for a group of adventurers to guard a ship bound for Safeton. The only questions are whether the lake really does have a mind of its own, and if so, are you brave (or greedy) enough to confront it?

A Dyvers waterborne regional adventure and part two of the Machinations Saga for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Membership in the Dyvers Adventurer’s Guild is highly recommended.

rpg: Hora de Aventuras Juego de Rol
213106.name: Hora de Aventuras: Dados
213106.description:
Contraportada:

¡Zuzumba! Los dados de Hora de Aventuras son los más chachis del País de Ooo y tienen el careto de tu personaje favorito en la cara del seis. Úsalos para jugar a los juegos que más te molan, como Hora de Aventuras: Juego de Rol, y convertirás tus partidas en una experiencia matemática. Qué digo matemática, ¡algebraica! Y si no se te ocurre qué hacer con ellos, cada set de un personaje incluye las reglas de un minijuego distinto para que pases un rato chachi. ¡No seas muermo y píllatelos, tron!

Este pack incluye: 12 dados personalizados de color morado con el rostro de la Princesa Bultos en la cara del seis.

213107.name: Black as Night
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213107.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Dyvers involvement with the Empire of the Old One has caused many waves in the City of Sails. A mysterious relic recently found its way back to the City of Sails. Forces now converge with you in the middle.

A one-round regional adventure set in Dyvers with particular interest for characters from the Iuz Border States for characters level 8 - 15.

213108.name: Walpurgis: The Dark Night
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213108.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Blood Moon heralded the coming of great evil and the Dark Night has arrived. The ever-increasing numbers of the orc horde threaten to overwhelm the Free Army and plunge the city of sails into permanent nightmare. Winter is born, the Dragon awakes, and Death walks anew.

A Dyvers regional adventure of graphic horror set in the village of Tricaster and a stage in The Gnarley Threat for [character levels] 2 - 12.

This event occurs after VTF6-05: Autumn and concurrently with VTF6-06: The Earth Dragon Cometh and contains untiered encounters.

rpgseries: VTF - Living Greyhawk Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventures
VTF6 - Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Season Six
213109.name: The Earth Dragon Cometh
213109.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Velverdyva Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A recent patron enlists your aid a second time. Not content with superior numbers, the Pomarj is searching for an edge to guarantee success for their northern campaign. Rumor continues to spread that the Gnarley Dragon has awakened. If the two are related, it could be devastating for all the Free Folk.

A meta-regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, the sequel to VTF6-03: Red on the Horizon, and a stage of The Gnarley Threat for character levels 4 to 15.

This event occurs concurrently with DYV6-06: Walpurgis: The Dark Night and contains untiered encounters.

PRINTING NOTE: This adventure includes color documents.

rpgseries: VTF - Living Greyhawk Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventures
VTF6 - Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Season Six
213110.name: Red on the Horizon
213110.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Velverdyva Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Two years ago, the Dread Pirate Sepp Daminov was lost in the Whirlpool of Madness. Now, his captain is looking for him. Markessa the Red has come to Dyvers.

A meta-regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers and a stage of The Gnarley Threat, for character levels 4 to 16.

213111.description:
Tile Number: 3829U

This monument is an exclusive promo tile available during the Cannes Games Festival in France (Feb 26 to Feb 28 2016).

Source: Website DoW

This tile was also available during Spiel'16 in Germany (Oct 13 to Oct 16 2016.

In Quadropolis, Monuments are rare buildings that allow you to score victory points when placed next to parks, shops, or public services. Be careful though, because placing them next to harbors or factories would only bring you negative points! They are only used in the Expert Mode, along with Office Towers.
213111.name: Quadropolis: Monument – Palais des Festivals de Cannes

213112.name: Knave of Box Town
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213112.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The war with Blackthorn has taken a turn for the worse, but that has not slowed the myriad machinations in the city of sails from continuing forward. Lord Grandhearth would reward those adventurers that saved his daughter, while word of Colonel Dolorrak’s kidnapped niece has surfaced. Word on the street is that there is a new king of Box Town, the Circle of Crimson Stone is holding public death matches, and worse, the Jackyll has supposedly returned to Dyvers.

An investigatory regional adventure of charity or cruelty set in the Free and Independent City of Dyvers for [character levels] 2 - 12.

213113.description:
The Pocket Universe is entering an era of tension as power surges throughout the galaxy.

Universal Rule: Edge of War introduces three new planet cards that integrate with the 4th X, exterminate. The Roza System is a protective pacifist planet, while Vianov has a very destructive Eater of Worlds ability. And in-between is Wovis, a sacrifice of a planet that destroys your own planets for great control over the battlefield. These three cards are shuffled in and three random cards are removed to mix up the Universal Rule game play.

The expansion was born from strech goals during the KickStarter campaign.
213113.name: Universal Rule: Edge of War

213114.name: In Search of Blackthorn
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213114.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Blackthorn Discovered! These two words have set the city ablaze. Merchant prepare to flee the city, warriors sharpen their sword and the commoners wait in fear and apprehension. Now, in a city where information in bought and sold alongside silk, the race is on to discover more about the humanoid activity there.

A one-round regional adventure set in Dyvers for [player characters] level 1 - 15.

213115.name: Profits From Beneath the Waves
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213115.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

A ship has been lost on the river. A journey into the Gnarley Forest is dangerous enough, but with orcs seen prowling the woods, adventurers must be wary at all times. Adventurers need to be hired to help recover the cargo before all is lost forever, beneath the waves of the Nyr Dyv. Make it through the woods, brave the river, and bring the cargo back to Dyvers and you will be rewarded.

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

213116.name: Darkwood
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213116.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Tricaster is growing! Once a small town in the wood it has grown into a bustling town of grand houses and businesses. There is earth to till and cattle to raise. Shopkeepers make a trade, and schools of different vocations are being raised. Yet, it is still a town in the wood, a dangerous wood known as The Gnarley, with the Pomarj are waiting in the shadows.

A cinematic one-round Dyvers Introductory adventure set in Tricaster for first level characters.

213117.name: A Sailor's Life for Me
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213117.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Your teacher has said you are ready. It's time to make your own way in the world. The sun is shining, and the waters of the Nyr Dyv beckon as the bustle of Dyvers surrounds you. All you need now is a job.

A one-round introductory adventure set in Dyvers for first-level characters.

213118.name: Last Laugh
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213118.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Core [sic] Adventure

From the introduction:

The Jolly Ogre – a popular tavern near the south gate of the Free City, and a great place for budding adventurers to find work. What if the work found them though? Would they be curious enough to investigate, and even more important, who would get the last laugh?

A Dyvers Introductory adventure for first-level characters.

213119.description:
Released as part of the December Special - anyone purchasing any item from the publisher's webstore during December 2013 received this promo along with the Dark Watch and a GloomWeaver Promo.







Spite Agent of Gloom has 90 lives.

SETUP
At the start of the game, put Spite's villain character cards into play, Agent of Gloom side up.

Remove all 5 Drug cards from the villain deck and put them face down in the villain play area. Search the villain deck for the card Safe House and put it into play. Shuffle the villain deck.

GAME PLAY
At the start of the villain turn, if there are (H) cards under the Safe House, flip Spite's villain character cards. If not, flip a Drug face up.

Whenever a Lab Raid would be played, discard it instead and Spite deals each Hero target 2 Melee damage.

At the end of the villain turn, Spite deals the Hero target with the highest HP (H) Infernal damage. If there are more cards under the Safe House than Drugs face up, flip a Drug face down.

ADVANCED
At the end of the villain turn, flip a Drug face up.







Spite Broken Vessel (flipside of Agent of Gloom) has 90 lives.

GAME PLAY
Increase damage dealt by Spite by 1 for each card under the Safe House.

Whenever a card is placed under the Safe House card, 1 player may draw a card.

Whenever a Lab Raid would be played, discard it instead and spite deals each Hero target 2 Melee damage.

At the start of each Hero Turn, that player may remove a card from under the Safe House and put it into play. If they do, they may play a card.

At the end of the villain turn, Spite deals the Hero target with the lowest HP (H) minus 1 melee damage.

ADVANCED
At the end of the villain turn, destroy a victim.
213119.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse Spite: Agent of Gloom Promo Card

213120.name: Vanguard
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213120.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The threat of Blackthorn continues to grow and work for adventures is not hard to come by at prices that are most agreeable. For some reason, a desperate plea, from a small village has gotten your attention. A halfling leader seeks your aid in finding several missing children in the village.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, town of Banebridge, for characters level 1 - 15.

A stage of The Gnarley Threat.

213121.name: Trouble at Grimhallow Manor
213121.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome To Grimhallow Manor!

Tread carefully in this spooky 5th-edition adventure for 3-5 players of 3rd-level.

Trouble at Grimhallow Manor is a horror-themed adventure that is; a) setting-agnostic (meaning that it can be easily picked up wholesale and dropped into other settings whether they're official, 3rd-party, or homebrew); b) fully standalone (meaning that it doesn't require other advenures or a lot of exposition to make sense of its narrative), and c) pretty short (sufficiently so that it can be run in just a handful of sessions).

Trouble at Grimhallow Manor is also incredibly versatile in the sense that it can be quickly adapted and modified to suit higher or lower-level groups or even parties of unusual sizes thanks to its unique 'machinations' system. The entire product is also super cheap (never a bad thing) and ultra accessible as it comes in a variety of formats (including 'standard', 'printer-friendly', and 'super printer-friendly'), and it also comes with printable art cards and a monster index (also available in 'standard', 'printer-friendly', and 'super printer-friendly' formats).

We could prattle on and on about Trouble at Grimhallow Manor but it's probably best to leave you to discover the sleepy manor-house and horrors that lurk within it for yourself. Check out the previews and, if you like what you see, pick up the adventure for yourself today (seriously don't, it's evil).

213122.name: Chain of Lies
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213122.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in The Free and Independent City of Dyvers

From the introduction:

In response to a growing demand for fighters in the Circle of Crimson Stone, there has been an alarming increase in the number of indentured servants being thrust into the fighting ring. Some believe that not all these indentured servants were legally obtained. You have been asked to conduct an undercover investigation.

A one-round Dyvers regional adventure for characters level 1 - 14.

This adventure is not recommended for [player characters] that rely heavily on magical or other material items.

213123.name: Dyvisions
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213123.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Trade through the Gnarley Forest has been reduced to a trickle, the Nyr Dyv poses a mysterious threat to the shipping lanes, and a rogue element rises in the west, surging in strength under the cry, "Achos 'r chrau chan Beryn."

A request for aid comes from three directions: one unknown, one unlikely, and the other unwanted. Can the adventurers end the divisions, or will more Divisions be required to end the unrest in the west?

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Westlands for characters level 1 - 14.

Part 3 of The Machinations Saga.

213124.name: Throw Open the Gates of Heaven
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213124.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Asyth Zomawyn has returned to Dyvers claiming that he has discovered the cure to his father's ailment. The ritual is complex in both composition and application. While he begins the ceremony, he asks that capable adventurers travel to the war-ravaged southern Gnarley and retrieve a component to his spell.

A Dyvers regional adventure set in the village of Tricaster and a stage in the Gnarley Threat for characters level 1 - 14.

213125.name: The Angry Wood
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213125.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The forces of Blackthorn move to the west, threatening to cut Dyvers off from its allies, and calls for assistance go out.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, in the hamlet of Jonas’ Landing, for characters level 1 - 15.

A stage of the Gnarley Threat.

213127.name: Siggoran's Gambit
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213127.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Over the last few years, waves of misfortune have befallen the heads of House Siggoran - assassinations, a baffling illness and now embezzlement and outright thievery. But the current Lady Siggoran has had enough, and she’s looking for some skilled adventurers who can help her even the score.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers in the City of Dyvers, on the Nyr Dyv, for characters level 1 - 15.

Recommended for [player characters] who don’t mind skirting the edges of the law.

213128.name: The Dyvide
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213128.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Helsim Lord Grift has ordered the evacuation of the Ehlenwood, and refugees are pouring into the Free City seeking protection from the relentless advancing horde of the Pomarj through the Gnarley Forest. Shandara Grift, Lord Grift’s eldest daughter, has embarked on a quest of redemption to right her wrongs in the sacking of Tricaster. Rumors of her demise abound, but now word comes that she is in need of aid deep in the Gnarley Forest. Are you willing to risk the dangers of the Gnarley Forest to aid one who has failed the City of Sails in the past?

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Ehlenwood fief of the Gnarley Forest for characters level 4 - 14.

Part 4 of The Machinations Saga.

213129.name: Crow's Nest
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213129.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

From high on their shadowy perch, cloaked figures scan the Dyvers dock district. Below, a small group of revelers stumble through the dark night, taking a wrong turn into an even darker alley. You have a chance to save them but will the reward be worth it?

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, in the City of Dyvers, for characters level 1 - 15.

213130.name: Darkness Cometh
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213130.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The City of Dyvers, once booming with economic prosperity, now languishes with poverty and overcrowding. Refugees flood in from the Free Lands, seeking shelter from the encroaching orc horde. The populace cries for Magister Hunter to protect them. The Gentry Council is less confident in her ability to withstand the invasion and seeks any method or ally to protect the city.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, for characters level 4 - 15.

A stage of the Gnarley Threat.

213131.name: A Small Problem
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213131.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What a nice, quiet night. Then you hear the scream and grab your gear, because somehow you know this is going to ruin your evening.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, in the City of Dyvers for characters level 1 - 15.

213132.name: Broken Circle
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213132.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in The Free and Independent City of Dyvers

From the introduction:

A simple job escorting a merchant from Maraven to Dyvers turns into an investigation of the Circle of Crimson Stone at the highest levels. Can you find out if the Circle has finally stepped over line they have been skirting for so long and, if so, can you put a stop to it in time?

A one-round Dyvers regional adventure for characters level 4 - 15.

213133.name: Wake the Dead
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213133.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The ambition of Turrosh Mak is not the only evil threatening the City of Sails. Another malignant force focuses its attention on the destruction of Dyvers. An unlikely request comes from one of the more controversial figures in Dyvers; the temple of Nerull needs your help in stopping an even greater evil.

Warning: This adventure contains at least one untiered encounter.

A one-round Dyvers Regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers, in Dyvers, for characters level 6 - 15.

213134.name: Gleaning the Cubes
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213134.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The armies of Blackthorn march toward the city. It is foretold that they will infiltrate Dyvers through the sewers. Only members of the constabulary and the Dyvers Vermin & Pest Contractors may lawfully enter, but gelatinous cubes, wererats, a stone golem, and a lich all call the sewers home. Things are afoot — underfoot.

A Dyvers regional adventure of investigation and dungeoneering set in the City of Dyvers for characters level 1 - 15.

213135.name: Dyvinity
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213135.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Molaho Khem: within his burgeoning faith, there are two very different branches in Dyvers. The Followers of the Cracked Shield are devoted to protecting the city, while the Servants of Glory are devoted to destroying the city’s enemies. Each branch considers the tenets of the other to be heresy, and so it is strange to have in your hand a letter from the Emissary of Molaho Khem, the pragmatic gnome and Servant of Glory, asking you to join him in meeting Bojan Starsinger, the Hand of Molaho Khem, Defender of Tricaster and Follower of the Cracked Shield. Is the consolidation of the Molaho Khem cults at hand? Or is this a sign of something greater? Perhaps the Hero god himself has brought about the oncoming slaughter to either search for another hero that will rise in Dyvers defense, or simply to view the carnage of battle.

A one-round Dyvers regional adventure for [character levels] 6 - 12, and the conclusion of the Machinations Saga.

213136.name: Plain Facts
rpgseries: DYV - Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventures
213136.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Dyvers Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Robert Lord Navoy leads his Free Army contingent across the Meadowlands in open war against Blackthorn. The city sits behind her walls in roiling terror. The city needs facts of what it is to face. What can you discover?

A one-round Dyvers regional adventure set in the Free Lands of Dyvers for characters level 1 - 15.

The penultimate adventure of the Gnarley Threat, leading directly into DYVINT8-01 The End.

213137.name: Lost Grimoires: Stolen Kingdom
213137.description:
Master alchemy to heal the kingdom!

Source: The Publisher Website.

213138.name: My Mom is a Witch
213138.description:
Pick your favorite hero and smash through hordes of enemies using your beat'em up and magic skills.

Source: The Developer Website.

213139.name: Craft Keep VR
213139.description:
Set within a fantasy world of dragons, dungeons and foul-mouthed customers, you are an alchemist-blacksmith forging weapons and brewing potions.

Source: The Publisher Website.

213140.name: Cup Critters
213140.description:
n CUP CRITTERS, you must manipulate gravity to keep those crazy balls in the cups. As you advance, your score gets higher and the tricks get more difficult. Great fun for casual players and core gamers alike!

Source: The Publisher Website.

213141.name: Shoot the Ball
213141.description:
In SHOOT THE BALL, your objective is simple - use the touch screen to "shoot" the ball into the open space scoring a point. Each shape is randomly given a speed and color to increase the difficulty. Challenge your family and friends to beat your session score. Have many times can you SHOOT THE BALL?

Source: The Publisher Website.

213142.name: Handball 17
213142.description:
Use all the real handball moves and tactics in Handball 17, the best handball simulation ever. Find the 82 official teams from the most prestigious European leagues: the LIDL STARLIGUE and PROLIGUE in France, the DKB Handball Bundesliga & 2. Handball-Bundesliga in Germany and the Liga ASOBAL in Spain.

Source: The Publisher Website.

213143.name: Stellar Stars
213143.description:
Reach for the stars in the world's 1st ever Multiplayer Online Roguelite Arena! Challenge other players (up to 4) in the fast-paced, competitive and procedurally generated arenas! Climb your way up the multiplayer leagues by grabbing trophies from winning matches!

Source: The Developer Website.

rpgseries: VTF - Living Greyhawk Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventures
VTF3 - Velverdyva, Tuflik, and Fals Trade Route Season Three
213144.name: Nor Crystal Falls
213144.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Tuflik, Fals, and Velverdyva Trade Route Meta-Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Local talk along the Velverdyva Trade Route speaks of adventure with Lords Burne and Rufus. The Lords have called for worthy adventures to interview for an expedition. No clues as to where or what the expedition is to be. Heroes that have dried the water from behind their ears are encouraged to seek an interview with Lords Burne and Rufus at Doomwatch Keep.

An introductory adventure to the Tuflik, Fals and Velverdyva Trade Route Metaregional Campaign for characters from level 3 to 14.

Part One of the Three is the Evilest Number Series

213145.name: PlayStation 4 Slim
213145.description:
User Summary

It is a revision of the original PS4 hardware and features a streamlined form factor; it has a rounded body with a matte finish on the top of the console rather than a two-tone finish, and is 40% smaller in size than the original model. The two USB ports on the front have a larger gap between them, and the optical audio port was removed.

213146.name: PlayStation 4 Pro
213146.description:
User Summary

It is an updated version of the PlayStation 4 with improved hardware, including an upgraded GPU with 4.2 teraflops of processing power, and a higher CPU clock. It is designed primarily to enable selected games to be playable at 4K and improved quality for the PlayStation VR. All PS4 games are completely compatible with both the PS4 and the PS4 Pro, but optimized games will have improved graphics performance on the PS4 Pro. Although capable of streaming 4K video, the PS4 Pro does not support Ultra HD Blu-ray. Additionally, the PS4 Pro is the only PS4 model which can Remote Play at 1080p, with the others limited to 720p.

213147.name: Crookz - the Big Heist
213147.description:
